title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: These Are the Best Packing Cubes on Amazon This Prime Day (2025)
items.description: If you aren't yet on the packing cube bandwagon, consider this your sign—these are my favorite Amazon sets I've tested, and most are on sale right now...

items.title: The World's Best Air Fryer Is 40 Percent Off
items.description: The Typhur Dome 2 air fryer makes fast wings and crispy pizza. It's a lot less expensive during Prime Big Deal Days.

items.title: The Future of AI Filmmaking Is a Parody of the Apocalypse, Made by a Guy Named Josh
items.description: Behold Neural Viz, the first great cinematic universe of the AI era.

items.title: We're Tracking All the Sales and Trends During Amazon's October Prime Day
items.description: We're tracking bargains, trends, and the general state of American capitalism live throughout Amazon's Big Deal Days sale.

items.title: The Best Cheap Asus Chromebook Has Dropped Below $250
items.description: Asus' budget Chromebook is cheaper than ever this Prime Day, with the price dropping to below $250 for the first time ever.

items.title: Lucid Motors sets record as Gravity sales pick up and tax credit expires
items.description: The company has seen EV deliveries increase for seven straight quarters, even though it's still way off the ambitious goals it promoted when it went p...

items.title: Taylor Swift fans accuse singer of using AI in her Google scavenger hunt videos
items.description: Swifties love a puzzle, but some were rubbed the wrong way by a promotional scavenger hunt which appeared to use AI-generated videos.

items.title: Microsoft buys another 100 MW of solar, this time in Japan
items.description: The new deal covers output from four different solar projects. Microsoft has said it will spend $2.9 billion to expand its infrastructure in Japan.

items.title: OpenAI ramps up developer push with more powerful models in its API
items.description: The updates were part of a series of announcements geared toward wooing developers to OpenAI’s ecosystem, including the launch of an agent-building to...

items.title: Deloitte goes all in on AI — despite having to issue a hefty refund for use of AI
items.description: Deloitte is rolling out Claude to its nearly 500,000 employees after issuing a refund for a report that contained AI hallucinations.
